name: Environmental Impact of Inhalers
title: MDIs prescribed as a proportion of all inhalers, excluding salbutamol
description: MDIs prescribed as a proportion of all inhalers in BNF Chapter 3, excluding salbutamol
why_it_matters: The NHS has committed to reducing its carbon footprint by 80% by 2028 to 2032,
including a shift to lower carbon inhalers. Dry powder inhalers (DPIs) and other newer types of inhalers like soft
mist inhalers are less harmful to the environment than traditional metered dose inhalers (MDIs).
includes an indicator focusing on the percentage of non-salbutamol MDIs prescriptions issued. NHSE Englandâ€™s aim is that, in line with best
practice in other European countries, by 2023/24 only 25% of non-salbutamol inhalers prescribed will be MDIs.

Please note: as prescribing data does not contain patient information, this measure uses prescription items for all ages.
This indicator is also calculated using items issued rather than prescriptions issued. The data shown will therefore not exactly match the IIF indicator.
